activities.loc: Monroe County Justice Center - Branch I

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Errol Patrick Johnson

records.addlTxt: Letter dated 9/27/22 to Defendant from Judicial Assistant (Kelly)

Defendant Errol Patrick Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Betthauser appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Reporter appears via DAR. Court states that Defendant is not eligible for a public defender. Court adjourns. Judicial assistant will mail a court appointed application to defendant.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name.

Defendant Errol Patrick Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Crystal N Long appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Grabow appears via zoom video. Court orders $1,000 signature bond with conditions. Notice of right to an attorney was given. Can apply for court appointed Attorney.
